meanings.definition: A long-handled brush used for sweeping.
meanings.sent1: She used the brooms to clean the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent2: The janitor grabbed one of the brooms to sweep the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The brooms in the closet seemed to gossip about the messy room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter swept through the room like a brooms, clearing away any tension.
meanings.sent5: The brooms stood in the corner, ready to tackle the dusty corners.

meanings.sent1: He brooms the porch every morning before breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She brooms the fallen leaves off the driveway with ease.
meanings.sent3: The wind playfully brooms the fallen petals across the garden.
meanings.sent4: His words brooms away any doubts she had about the project.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of her brooming was oddly soothing.
